Package view_control

Class AddCustomerWindowController

java.lang.Object
view_control.AddCustomerWindowController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class AddCustomerWindowController
extends java.lang.Object
implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
Version:
1.0 Provides the methods necessary to add a Customer object to the database.
Author:
Brayden McArthur

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void cancelButtonClicked()
    Sets the scene back to the Customer window, which also reloads the table view with the data from the database.

    When a country is selected from the country combo box, the division combo box is set to a list of all divisions that are associated with the chosen country in the database

    Initializes the country combo box to the list of all countries listed in the database.

    If valid input has been entered, a Customer object is created from the provided input and inserted into the database.

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize​(java.net.URL url, java.util.ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
      Initializes the country combo box to the list of all countries listed in the database.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Parameters:
      url - A URL.
      resourceBundle - A ResourceBundle.

    • countryComboBoxOnAction

      public void countryComboBoxOnAction() throws java.lang.Exception
      When a country is selected from the country combo box, the division combo box is set to a list of all divisions that are associated with the chosen country in the database
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - Throws Exception if there is an error in Fetcher.
      See Also:
      Fetcher

    • okButtonClicked

      public void okButtonClicked() throws java.lang.Exception
      If valid input has been entered, a Customer object is created from the provided input and inserted into the database.
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - Throws Exception if there is an error in DateAndTime, EditDatabase, or Fetcher.
      See Also:
      DateAndTime, EditDatabase, Fetcher

    • cancelButtonClicked

      public void cancelButtonClicked() throws java.io.IOException
      Sets the scene back to the Customer window, which also reloads the table view with the data from the database.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - Throws IOException if there is an error loading the FXML file.

    • validateInput

      public boolean validateInput()
      Validates the input entered by the user. All fields must not be empty and non String type fields must only contain whole numbers. If invalid data is entered an Alert Box displays the error message in an alert window.
      Returns:
      Returns True if all if statements are false.

    • setNextId

      public void setNextId()
      Sets the next available ID for the ID column of a particular table.

    • getNextId

      public int getNextId()
      Gets the NextId
      Returns:
      Returns the NextId as an integer.
